titleStmt.title: The dying tears of a true lover forsaken, made on his death-bed; the hour before his death. To the tune of, Come live with me.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for F. Coles, T. Vere, J. Wright, J. Clarke, W. Thackeray, and T. Passinger.,

notesStmt.note: Place and date of publication suggested by Wing.
The names of the lovers are said to have been Hugh Hill and Sarah.
Verse: "Those gentle hearts that true love crave ..."
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University, Houghton Library and the British Library.
